sen.j: 武田 五一（たけだ ごいち、 明治5年11月15日 (旧暦)（1872年12月15日） - 1938年(昭和13年)2月5日）は、備後国備後福山藩（現・広島県福山市）生まれ。
sen.e: Goichi Takeda (December 3, 1872-February 5, 1938) was born in Bingofukuyama Domain, Bingo Province (current Fukuchiyama City, Hiroshima Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 原文では明治5年11月15日 (旧暦)（1872年12月15日）となっていましたが、明治5年11月15日 (旧暦)（1872年12月3日）と訂正しました。
sen.e: Goichi Takeda (December 3, 1872-February 5, 1938) was born in Bingofukuyama Domain, Bingo Province (current Fukuchiyama City, Hiroshima Prefecture).
Goichi Takeda (December 15, 1872-February 5, 1938) was born in Bingofukuyama Domain, Bingo Province (current Fukuchiyama City, Hiroshima Prefecture).

sen.j: 「関西建築界の父」とも言われる日本の建築家で、近代日本を代表する建築家の一人。
sen.e: He was an architect called as 'the father of Kansai Architect World,' and the one who represented modern Japanese architects.
He was an architect called 'the father of the Kansai Architect World,' and represented modern Japanese architects.
He was an architect called 'the father of the Kansai Architect World,' and represented modern Japanese architects.

sen.j: ヨーロッパ留学で影響を受けたアール・ヌーボー、ウィーン分離派など、新しいデザインを日本に紹介した建築家、とも言われる。
sen.e: He was also called as an architect who introduced new designs into Japan by being influenced by art nouveau and Vienna division schools during his study abroad.
He was also called an architect who introduced new designs into Japan by being influenced by art nouveau and Vienna division schools during his study abroad.
He was also called an architect who introduced new designs into Japan by being influenced by art nouveau and Vienna division schools during his study abroad.

sen.j: 建築以外にも工芸や図案・テキスタイルデザインなども手掛けた。
sen.e: He also contributed to the field of crafts, designs, and textile designs besides architecture.
He also contributed to the field of crafts, designs, and textile designs besides architecture.
He also contributed to the field of crafts, designs, and textile designs besides architecture.

sen.j: 自身の作品のみならず、京都高等工芸学校（現・京都工芸繊維大学）図案科や京都帝国大学（現・京都大学）に工学部建築学科を創立し多くの後進を育成した。
sen.e: He established Faculty of Design course in Kyoto Handicraft High School (current Kyoto Institute of Technology) and the Faculty of Engineering Undergraduate School of Architecture in Kyoto Imperial University (current Kyoto University) and educated many young people.

He established the Faculty of Design course in Kyoto Handicraft High School (current Kyoto Institute of Technology) and the Faculty of Engineering Undergraduate School of Architecture in Kyoto Imperial University (current Kyoto University) and educated many young people.

He established the Faculty of Design course in Kyoto Handicraft High School (current Kyoto Institute of Technology) and the Faculty of Engineering Undergraduate School of Architecture in Kyoto Imperial University (current Kyoto University) and educated many young people.

sen.j: フランク・ロイド・ライトとも親交があり、国会議事堂建設をはじめ多くのプロジェクトに関与している。
sen.e: He also communicated with Frank Lloyd Wright and participated in many projects including the construction of the Diet Building.
He also communicated with Frank Lloyd Wright and participated in many projects including the construction of the Diet Building.
He also communicated with Frank Lloyd Wright and participated in many projects including the construction of the Diet Building.

sen.j: 法隆寺、平等院などの古建築修復にも関わりが深い。
sen.e: He also took part greatly with the restoration of old architecture such as Horyu-ji and Byodo-in Temples.
He also took part greatly with the restoration of old architecture such as Horyu-ji and Byodo-in Temples.
He also took part greatly with the restoration of old architecture such as Horyu-ji and Byodo-in Temples.

sen.j: 1872年（明治5年）備後福山藩士の家に出生
sen.e: 1872: He was born in the house of a feudal retainer of Bingofukuyama Domain.
1872: He was born in the house of a feudal retainer of Bingofukuyama Domain.
1872: He was born in the house of a feudal retainer of Bingofukuyama Domain.

sen.j: 1897年（明治30年）東京大学工科大学卒業。
sen.e: 1897: He graduated from Department of Engineering in Tokyo University.
1897: He graduated from the Department of Engineering at Tokyo University.
1897: He graduated from the Department of Engineering at Tokyo University.
He continued to a graduate school.
He continued to graduate school.
He continued to graduate school.

sen.j: 1900年（明治33年）大学院を中退し、東大助教授就任
sen.e: 1900: He dropped out from a graduate school and became an associate professor at Tokyo University.
1900: He dropped out from graduate school and became an associate professor at Tokyo University.
1900: He dropped out from graduate school and became an associate professor at Tokyo University.

sen.j: 1901年（明治34年）図案研究のためヨーロッパ留学（1903年まで）
sen.e: 1901: He travelled to Europe to study designs (until 1903).
1901: He traveled to Europe to study designs (until 1903).
1901: He traveled to Europe to study designs (until 1903).

sen.j: 1903年（明治36年）帰国、京都高等工芸学校（現・京都工芸繊維大学）教授
sen.e: 1903: He returned to Japan and became a professor of Kyoto Handicraft High School (current Kyoto Institute of Technology).
1903: He returned to Japan and became a professor of Kyoto Handicraft High School (current Kyoto Institute of Technology).
1903: He returned to Japan and became a professor of Kyoto Handicraft High School (current Kyoto Institute of Technology).

sen.j: 1908年（明治41年）大蔵省臨時建築部技師を兼任。
sen.e: 1908: He held an additional position of temporal architect of Ministry of Finance.
1908: He held an additional position of temporal architect of the Ministry of Finance.
1908: He held an additional position of temporal architect of the Ministry of Finance.

sen.j: 議院建築のため欧米視察
sen.e: He went to Europe and the United States to study for Diet Building construction.
He went to Europe and the United States to study for the Diet Building construction.
He went to Europe and the United States to study for the Diet Building construction.

sen.j: 1916年（大正5年）法隆寺壁画保存会委員
sen.e: 1916: He served as a member of a committee for preserving the wall art of Horyu-ji Temple.
1916: He served as a member of a committee for preserving the wall art of Horyu-ji Temple.
1916: He served as a member of a committee for preserving the wall art of Horyu-ji Temple.

sen.j: 1918年（大正7年）名古屋高等工業学校（現・名古屋工業大学）校長
sen.e: 1918: He became a principle of Nagoya Higher Technical School (current Nagoya Institute of Technology)
1918: He became a principal of Nagoya Higher Technical School (current Nagoya Institute of Technology).
1918: He became a principal of Nagoya Higher Technical School (current Nagoya Institute of Technology).

sen.j: 1920年（大正9年）京都帝国大学建築学科教授（1932年まで）
sen.e: 1920: He served as a Professor of Architecture of Kyoto Imperial University (until 1932).
1920: He served as a Professor of Architecture of Kyoto Imperial University (until 1932).
1920: He served as a Professor of Architecture of Kyoto Imperial University (until 1932).
1938: He passed away at the age of 67.
1938: He passed away at the age of 67.
1938: He passed away at the age of 67.
